front.title: BGP4 router ID for IPv6 only routers

abstract.t: BGP4 [1] uses a 32 bit field to identify router (the so called'router-IDs'). In IPv4 domain, an IPv4 address of the routeris typically used in this field.In an IPv6 routing domain, routers may very well not have any IPv4Addresses. This document provides a simple way to form a globallyUnique ID in such a case.
